cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles SE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then north-northeast, crossing the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and approaching the west coast of Florida (Englewood–Anclote River, including Tampa Bay) late Wednesday into Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: West coast of Florida near or just south of Tampa Bay (Englewood–Anclote River zone)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Anclote River to the Suwannee River; Storm Surge Watch farther north and along the Atlantic coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Englewood to Anclote River (includes Tampa Bay); Storm Surge Warning Anclote River southward to Flamingo, including Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central west Florida coast from Bonita Beach northward to Suwannee River, with highest impacts in and around Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds very likely (92% chance); hurricane-force winds possible (13% chance of 64-kt, 31% chance of 50-kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 5–10 ft possible in Tampa Bay and along adjacent coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches expected with local amounts up to 20 inches, causing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Tuesday night–Wednesday; dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged river flooding inland.
